text: hello this is chef john from food wishes
calm with farinata that's right this is
like my new favorite food it's
incredibly delicious very comforting
super easy to make and it's very rustic
Italian oven baked pancake for lack of a
better description is made with the
garbanzo flour and the first time I made
this I could not believe how such a
simple batter could produce such a tasty
and interesting dish
that apparently is really good for you
so step one in a mixing bowl we have our
garbanzo bean flour now I found this
next to all the specialty gluten-free
flours at the regular supermarket but if
you can't find that there any health
food store is going to have it and to
our garbanzo bean flour we're going to
add enough warm water to make basically
a thin batter not too hot just barely
warm spine and they say you should
sturdy and gradually but you know what
I've never been a big fan of what they
say so I just dump it all in and whisk
and it works perfectly so I'm not sure
while the recipe say add it gradually
but suit yourself and we want to mix
that up until completely completely
smooth so keep whisking yes if you want
to dirty your blender or a Murshid mixer
you can use those so we're going to mix
that up completely smooth and at that
point all we're going to do is cover it
I'm gonna use a plate and set a plastic
wrap because I love the earth I want to
be nice for your grandkids so we're
gonna cover that with something and
we're gonna let it sit there for two
hours at room temperature you're going
to need to go find something to do for a
few hours what did I do while I waited
just chilled and after two hours we're
going to uncover it and it's gonna look
like this yes it gets a little foamy so
at this point you're going to need to
take a spoon or a ladle and skim off
that foam my source is deep within the
farinata subculture tell me that foam is
what people have trouble digesting and
if you don't skim it this recipe will be
much noisier alright so we're going to
skim off as much of that as we can and
like I said it's going to make it more
artsy let's party and after that we're
going to add the last couple ingredients
we're of course going to need some salts
and a decent amount of it we're also
going to add some olive oil and then one
optional ingredient that's not in the
traditional recipe but it is a common
addition some very finely minced
rosemary and we're going to stir that in
very well we're going to let that sit
there for about 10 minutes while we
preheat our oven and prep our pan so on
the stove we're going to place down a
10-inch cast-iron skillet we're going to
place that on high heat
eat and get it smoking-hot and by the
way while we're doing this you're
definitely gonna want to pre-heat your
oven to 500 degrees so that's ready to
roll and once we think our pan is really
hot we're going to pour in some
additional olive oil yes a lot of it but
don't worry olive oil is really really
good for you
or at least that's what a doctor that
work for the olive oil company said and
why would they lie they have to take an
oath so pour in the olive oil and then
stand there looking at it and as soon as
you see that first little wisp of smoke
quickly pour in your batter and it would
probably help fun like me you poured it
right in the center I kind of went in
from the side but don't worry it's not
going to matter but you're going to pour
in that batter and then you're quickly
but very carefully transfer that into
the center of your preheated 500 degree
oven and let that bake for about 25 to
30 minutes or until it looks like this
and I remember thinking the first time I
made it before I'd even tasted it I said
to myself look at that that's going to
taste good and I was right and by the
way this is one of the few things we
make I don't make you let cool a little
bit as soon as you can transfer it onto
a plate you want to serve this right
away it's not nearly as good cold and
then traditionally all this is garnished
with is freshly ground black pepper and
you might be thinking I'll just use that
stuff I have in the can it's worked fine
for the last seven years why change now
trust me fresh black pepper for this
please and as soon as we've pepper eyes
that we're going to go ahead and take
our pizza cutter and we'll cut this up
into I don't know six or eight portions
that's probably what they get in Italy
in LA you probably get 16 portions out
of this is Chicago of course this would
be a single portion so it depends on
where you are but any way you decide
you're the Heidi Fleiss
of your slice and then as soon as that's
cut up serve it immediately this is way
way way better hot than cold and because
of that extra hot oven and that olive
oil we're going to get a beautiful
crispy crusty exterior and yet the
inside is going to stay nice and moist
kind of dense but not unpleasantly so
just very very earthy and comforting and
satisfying just truly delicious stuff
after this first bite I was like what
are you doing just use your hands come
on and if you have not made this before
before you go putting a bunch of
toppings on it try it just like this it
is so good you'll know why it's not
traditionally topped with anything of
course having said that do not be
surprised if you see a future
tricked-out version and the
possibilities are is
is air exciting so stay tuned for that
but in the meantime I really really hope
